info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued February 08 at 3:23AM EST until February 08 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility 1 mile or less in freezing fog. * WHERE...Mainly for the Blue Ridge foothills and Piedmont. * WHEN...Until 9 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential frost on bridges, overpasses, and less traveled secondary roads as well as sidewalks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moist ground, fog, and temperatures below freezing are favorable conditions for black ice development on untreated surfaces. Above ground surfaces may also be coated with a layer of heavy frost. In either case, expect a thin layer of icing on roads, bridges, overpasses, and sidewalks.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Also, be alert for frost or black ice on bridges, overpasses, less traveled secondary roads, and sidewalks.
